sentences: The G-77/CHINA stressed its proposals on financing and technology, and the need to organize the AWG-LCA s work in a manner that allows for effective participation.
The UMBRELLA GROUP highlighted the need to move to full negotiation mode and discuss legal issues in 2009.
Barbados, for AOSIS, called for serious negotiations and a focused work programme with concrete milestones.

The EU stressed synergies between the AWG-LCA and AWG-KP and the importance of a shared vision as a statement of political will that translates the Convention s ultimate objective into a vision of sustainable development.
The AFRICAN GROUP stressed that a shared vision also involves sustainable development and adaptation, and called for upscaled funding and attention to climate change-related migration.
The LDCs said a shared vision should involve global targets and stabilizing greenhouse gas concentrations at 350 ppm.
